snippet: Gen. Salim Idriss, the leader of the Free Syrian Army, sought to rebut key arguments against arming the rebels, including fears of sectarian conflict and Islamist influence.
abstract: Gen Salim Idriss, leader of Free Syrian Army, declares opposition will 'never give up' and asks for more support, even as push by France and Britain to arm outgunned rebels draws heavy resistance from other European countries.

byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: Andrew Higgins reported from Brussels, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva, and Steven Erlanger from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: Gen. Salim Idriss, the leader of the Free Syrian Army, sought to rebut key arguments against arming the rebels, including fears of sectarian conflict and Islamist influence.

headline.seo: Bid by Britain and France to Arm Syria Rebels Is Resisted
headline.main: Other Europeans Balk at Bid by Britain and France to Arm Syria’s Rebels
headline.print_headline: Other Europeans Balk at Bid by Britain and France to Arm Syria’s Rebels
